reviews.customers_say: Customers love the dress's style with its buttons, beautiful matte satin material, and well-made construction.

items.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Loved this dress
items.body: I am 5 feet tall, 125 lbs, and I used the sizing info provided by the manufacturer, which did not lead me astray. However, when I wore it, I used a steel boned overbust corset, a hoopskirt, and petticoats to help with the silhouette. I recommend the use of corseting at the least, or other shapewear under the dress: 1: because some of the seams are a little loose, and a corset will take the strain from that part of your body, so the dress will live longer 2: it will really improve the way the dress "wears" on the body, aesthetically The dress fabric was much heavier than I'd expected, but that's a good thing; it's a nice, thick fabric. The only closure on it is laces that go down a pretty long way down the back. The dress comes completely unlaced, and some of the loops were a bit small, so lacing it up was a little bit of a challenge, but I just used something to push the tie through, and that was fine. The tie is two strips of the dress fabric sewn together with a seam in the middle. I had to reinforce mine, because it was coming undone. There are no pockets, all the buttons are cosmetic, and some might require a little securing. The cuffs were *very* wide. I had planned to use some kind of cuff over them to keep them from making me look like I was wearing an oversized sweatshirt, but wound up just folding the cuffs up, since there's a slit, so it creates a little winged cuff. I think the sleeves should have some kind of lace-up or adjustability feature as well. But it wasn't a super huge issue. I'd love to find a reason to wear it again. Read more
items.author: Shannah

items.title: 4.0 out of 5 stars great dress but problematic sleeves
items.body: I love this dress. It‚Äôs elegant, beautiful, and great quality, but I ended up taking off the sleeves. SIZE 4, LAVENDER TL;DR I took off the sleeves because they were too tight on my arms, too loose on my shoulders, I wasn‚Äôt sure how to style the cuffs due to those previous problems, and the fabric wouldn‚Äôt be breathable enough for the high-energy event I was attending. PROBLEMS: I have somewhat skinny arms, but the fabric lining the sleeves gave absolutely no leeway and were very tight. It was difficult to raise my arms higher than my shoulders. Ironically, the sleeves couldn‚Äôt stay on my shoulders. Once the fabric reached my shoulders, it was too big. I could‚Äôve just went with the off-the-shoulder look if I didn‚Äôt have to move my arms much. The cuffs at the end of the sleeves are a little odd-looking when the sleeves don‚Äôt stay on your shoulders because then the sleeves are too long and the weird (in my opinion) half-buttoned/half-not forearm cuff is lowered and now over your hands. The fabric isn‚Äôt very breathable. WHAT I LOVE: The lace-up back is beautiful, I got SO many compliments (even from complete strangers), gorgeous fabric and color, and I FELT LIKE A PRINCESS!!! MODIFICATIONS: I bought a size 4, hemmed the dress, and took off the sleeves and replaced it with straps made of the extra material from the hemmed skirt. IN THE PHOTOS (sorry for the bad quality): Along with the modifications, I ironed the dress and had a petticoat underneath. Read more
items.author: Becky

items.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful fit and beautiful in person
items.body: The dress was gorgeous. I went with the other reviews and went up a size. The dress was perfect for my prom and I felt like a real life princess. The material was great quality and wasn't too heavy on the dance floor. My only problem with the dress is that it's so long that it can be kind of hard to walk around in. Other than that I loved it Read more
items.author: Kelechi

items.title: 1.0 out of 5 stars Wished it was better :(
items.body: Unfortunately this dress was SO tight I couldnt wear it and it was incredibly heavy! I loved it though but just not for me. Read more
items.author: Daniella Rodriguez

items.title: 3.0 out of 5 stars just soooo, so bad
items.body: First of all, I specifically looked for dresses that had reviews/pics from bigger girls ‚Äî & they all looked beautiful, btw. I‚Äôm on the verge of plus size after having that ‚Äúoops‚Äù baby at 40 (being my 4th kid, after 8 years, it completely wrecked my body). But I didn‚Äôt realize that my chest size would make such a big difference. And tbh, it wasn‚Äôt *just* my chest size üòû. The short of it is this: I looked horrible, I felt horrible & I‚Äôm returning the dress. I went with burgundy thinking it‚Äôd be dark & slimming (like black, but not as ‚Äúclich√©‚Äù) but instead (& esp bc the burgundy leaned a lot more purple than brown or red) I looked like the purple pie eater‚Äôs sister. Like a short (I‚Äôm around 5‚Äô1.5‚Äù), fat, overripe, smashed, grape. Like if I wanted to be a princess troll but ended up a bergen. It was really bad. I‚Äôm gonna go over each point now & try to be as brief as possible while still providing an explanation. If you‚Äôre like me & just need to know why, then read on. If you don‚Äôt have the time, well, you‚Äôve got the gist already. First of all the dress was heavy. I thought it was an exaggeration, but it‚Äôs not. Pair that with the lace up back & my claustrophobia (that even I didn‚Äôt know was *that* intense) = I felt trapped in that dress. It did take a while for me to tighten it myself & it really was ‚Äútricky‚Äù (i.e. crazy difficult; esp being dyslexic & trying to do it behind my own back in the mirror). It was like trying to perform a magic trick on myself, but it obviously didn‚Äôt work bc I already knew what was going on behind the curtain. And loosening the ties was a lot harder than tightening them. So I had a baby panic attack, like a toddler who gets stuck in a swimsuit with the weird straps. I ordered according to my bust measurement (bc I didn‚Äôt want it to be too small & give me the 4 boob look OR just be too low & immodest), which was way up from my ‚Äúnormal‚Äù size ‚Äî & it ended up being huge on me. And that poor lace up back can only do so much. Why didn‚Äôt I give them my exact measurements? Bc that has never, never, ever, worked for me (& bc I wanted to be able to return it). My body is oddly shaped & my measurements never fit the the actual size I need to wear. My bust is the perfect example. It‚Äôs 41‚Äù ‚Äî I measured at different times, on different days, with different tapes & it was 41‚Äù every time. I saw a video of a plus size girl, who also had a 41‚Äù bust, who was also 5‚Äô2‚Äù. You guys. She had DD‚Äôs & I have B‚Äôs. So obviously I have a gigantic rib cage & tiny t‚Äôs. Like I can‚Äôt wear any of the ‚Äúsmall‚Äù bras in B cups bc I‚Äôm too wide. And with this dress, just knowing my inches doesn‚Äôt do anything for me, bc it fit me great in width ‚Äî but the cups were 2 sizes too big. Not even kidding, I could have fit both my boobs into one cup. üòû Then there‚Äôs the waist area. That‚Äôs where I was wrecked the most bc I‚Äôve had 4 c-sections. I can‚Äôt even do ab workouts bc my muscles have been cut into so many times that even just bending over often gives me a charlie-horse type cramp to the point where I get stuck & have to massage it out to get unstuck. Also I‚Äôm Asian & always thought I had a long torso & short legs. But this torso was so long on me that the waist cut into the fattest part of my stomach flab. And no amount of tightening those laces would fix it, bc the part under the waist is just the ‚Äúfree flowing‚Äù skirt ‚Äî which is PLEATED. Pleats add volume, so instead of slimming anything it made me look poofier. And bc of exactly where it hit on my body, I simultaneously got a muffin top AND and even bigger fupa. Not the look anyone is going for, I‚Äôm sure. Then we have the behind. Again, I ordered up (at least 2 sizes, to fit my bust, according to their chart) so the dress was obviously too big all over. I really knew it when I kept getting poked in my butt crack with the bottom of the laces. Like the very bottom of it goes to a point, & that point was situated way down at the bottom of my butt checks. I don‚Äôt know where it‚Äôs actually supposed to stop. On me, it looked like I was trying to hide a tail on my super flat behind, under my dress. Then we have the sleeves. I should have known it was way too big when all the reviews of girls looking awesome said the inner sleeves were tight. My sleeves were so loose that I couldn‚Äôt pretend to imagine where my arms actually were. I think the wrist parts were several inches below my hand & bunching it up to get my hands out made the bottom of the sleeves puff up, while also falling off my shoulders. I‚Äôm an older girl here, so I have those flabby under arms that wave at people while I‚Äôm waving my hand. When I have my arms down I just kind of look like a linebacker ‚Äî wide ribs, flat chest & big arms. These sleeves just doubled that so I ended up looking like the suit with the shrunken head from Beetleguise. Not even kidding. I never had a small-head complex before & now I‚Äôm trying to figure out how to make my hair huge to make my head look bigger!!! Let‚Äôs repeat that just once to really take it in ‚Äî I am trying to make my head look bigger ‚Ä¶ to even it out with my enormous rib cage & arm fat. What in the ever loving ‚Ä¶. üòµ‚Äçüí´ So I guess I looked more like the syrup eating jock than the purple pie eater‚Äôs sister. Or the sister who ate the purple pie eater. I‚Äôm gonna just go out on a limb here & say it‚Äôs *probably* bc I ordered way above my size. And I did that based on the reviews. I should have known better, bc size charts have *NEVER* worked for me. All that extra fabric & wrong dimensions did nothing but exacerbate my worst features (I mean, it gave me a 10 pound fupa!). I am so traumatized from the horrors of my body ‚Äî & getting momentarily stuck (you know, like trying to look away before you see the really gory part of a slasher movie, but timing it wrong & seeing ALL of the gore close up in HD) ‚Äî that I don‚Äôt even want to try it on in my actual size. I hardly want to try on another dress in my life. So that was MY journey to Mordor, as an extremely bloated gollum. Not a princess story like everyone else. I‚Äôd say ‚Äúorder your size‚Äù but some people sized up with great results. So my advice is to follow your gut. Mine said ‚Äúdon‚Äôt do it‚Äù & I was like, psshhht, you don‚Äôt see these pictures. I should have listened to my gut; this dress was not for me. PS. My profile height/weight is pre-baby. I don‚Äôt have the courage to get on the scale post-baby, so I don‚Äôt even know (or want to know really) what my actual weight is. It‚Äôs enough that I fit nothing else but my previously oversized sweat pants ‚Ä¶ & my maternity jeans. Read more
items.author: Atska808

items.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Absolutely Stunning
items.body: Dress was perfect. Not sure of the sizing because I purposely ordered it 2 sizes bigger since it was coming from China. The strings in the back allowed me to adjust and pull the dress tight. I would recommend ordering a petticoat for a princess look (as I have on in the picture). The weight and material of the dress is great! Didn't look cheap at all and I received many compliments. Read more
items.author: K. Will

short_description:
Womens Maxi Dress Formal Evening is made for a polished look that still feels comfortable to wear. It is designed to sit cleanly on the body with a flattering shape that works for day plans and dressier moments without feeling overdone.

The fit focuses on balance rather than extremes, so you can move naturally while still getting a defined silhouette. Choose your usual size for a closer look, or size up if you prefer a little more ease through the waist and hips.

Styling is simple: keep accessories minimal for a clean finish, or add a jacket and statement shoes when you want a sharper outfit. This piece photographs well thanks to smooth lines and a structured feel that stays put once you have it adjusted.

With the right fit and simple styling, this item becomes an easy go-to when you want something that looks intentional without requiring extra effort.

If you are between sizes, choose based on how close you like the fit through the waist and hips, then adjust with your usual layering choices.

For the best look, smooth the fabric, check the neckline placement, and pair it with shoes that match the occasion and the hem length.

long_description:
Womens Maxi Dress Formal Evening is a versatile piece you can reach for when you want a put-together look that still feels comfortable. The goal is simple: a silhouette that reads polished, photographs well, and stays wearable for a full day or a long night.

Fit and sizing Fit is where most outfits win or lose. This design aims for a balanced shape with a defined line through the torso, a clean waist, and a smooth finish through the hips and legs. If you prefer a more relaxed feel, size up; if you like a closer fit, stay true to size. Sizes may include: XS, S, M, L, XL.

Fabric and comfort Comfort is not just about softness. It is also about movement and how the fabric behaves as you walk, sit, and stand. A fabric blend with a bit of give helps it keep its shape while still feeling wearable.

Highlights A clean neckline and a refined silhouette for an elevated look. Designed to layer easily with jackets, wraps, or sweaters. Works well with both minimal accessories and statement pieces.

How to style Styling ideas: keep it minimal with neutral shoes and one standout accessory. For a relaxed daytime look, add a denim jacket or cardigan. For events, switch to a bolder shoe and a small clutch for a sharper finish.

Color notes Available colors may include: Brown, Peach, Fuchsia, Black, Champagne, Dusty Blue, Orange, Royal, Lime, Peacock, Plum, Lavender, Teal, Turquoise. If a shade is sold out, check back as availability can change.

Care Care guidance matters if you want it to keep its shape and finish. Follow the label first.
